snippet: The Mujahedeen Khalq, also known as M.E.K., has been lobbying to be removed from the State Department’s terrorist list, but its refusal to leave a camp in Iraq has caused concern.
abstract: State Department officials are preparing for a possible decision by Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton to redesignate Iranian opposition group Mujahedeen Khalq as a terrorist organization, in part because of the group's opposition to abandoning its camp in Iraq; group has mounted a costly campaign to stay off the list, insisting that it abandoned violence years ago.
lead_paragraph: The Mujahedeen Khalq, also known as M.E.K., has been lobbying to be removed from the State Department’s terrorist list, but its refusal to leave a camp in Iraq has caused concern.

headline.seo: Iranian Group M.E.K. May Remain on U.S. Terror List
headline.main: Iran Group May Remain on U.S. Terror List
headline.print_headline: Iraq: Iranian Group May Return To U.S. Terrorist List Over Camp
